oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparative Efficacy Studies: Tilmicosin vs Long-Acting Oxytetracycline or Ceftiofur for Treatment of Bovine Respiratory Disease in Newly Received Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Laudert, Scott B.
Guthrie, Carl A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: efficacy study
tilmicosin
long-acting oxytetracycline
ceftiofur
bovine respiratory disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Six comparative efficacy studies were conducted to evaluate tilmicosin (TIL) and either long-acting oxytetracycline (LAO) (3 studies) or ceftiofur (CFT) (3 studies) for treatment of bovine respiratory disease (BRD) in newly received salebarn or ranch calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 180
